intro: Gymnadenia × trummeriana, commonly known as the hybrid grass of the genus Gymnadenia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to central and eastern Europe. It belongs to the orchid family (Orchidaceae) and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands, often in nutrient-poor soils. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color and are arranged in a spike-like inflorescence. Gymnadenia × trummeriana is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its aesthetic appeal.
